Re: License #: CP740201421
Dear Stella Daniels:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
6/26/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (a) Within 30 calendar days from removal
from the home.
One of the eight current foster child records reviewed contained an initial service
plan that was completed outside the time frame required by this rule. In this
example the initial service plan for the time period ending 6/10/2023 was completed
9/25/2023.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of the eight current foster child records reviewed included one updated service
plan that was completed outside the time frame established by this rule. In this
example the service plan for the time period ending 9/8/2023 was completed
2

9/29/2023. This was the same foster child record that also included the late initial
service plan.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (5) If an agency is no longer providing services to
the child in a foster home, then both the following
must be documented before a change in
placement:
• (a) A summary of the services provided
during care up to the time of the change in
placement and the needs that remain to be
met.
Two of the four foster care youth discharge records reviewed contained discharge
documentation that was completed outside the time frame of this rule. The first
youth had an identified discharge date of 2/23/2024 and the discharge
documentation was completed 6/17/2024. The second youth had an identified
discharge date of 11/13/2023 and the documentation for this discharge was
completed 6/17/2024.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided related to FTM documentation and
Medical Passport expectations. FTM information needs to be uploaded timely.
Medical passports need to be generated quarterly preferably as a part of each
USP completion timeline.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There was 1 incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. Special evaluation #2023C0000659 substantiated the use of corporal
punishment by the foster parent admitting to pulling the foster child’s ear to get the
foster child’s attention. The findings also substantiated the foster father using the
threat of physical harm as a form of discipline. No abuse/neglect findings were
3

determined. Revocation of the license was recommended and submitted on
8/04/2023. The revocation is currently in process and has not yet been completed.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
previous renewal evaluation for St. Clair County DHHS completed in April 2023
indicated noncompliance in the areas of Rule 324(8), FOM 722-06 B, and FOM
722-08 D. None of the areas were identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of
this interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the agency’s compliance
with their Corrective Action Plan for the most recent renewal evaluation. The
assessment indicated the agency continues to struggle with timely signatures and
consistency with following the CAP procedures. Despite this barrier the trend
identified in the assessment was positive and the CAP appeared to have a
positive impact in areas where total compliance was not yet achieved.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Interviews did
not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
